text: A Life Dedicated to God
Therefore I exhort you, brothers, through the mercies of God, to present your bodies \add as\add* a living sacrifice, holy \add and\add* pleasing to God, \add which is\add* your reasonable service.
And do not be conformed to this age, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, so that you may approve what \add is\add* the good and well-pleasing and perfect will of God.
A Variety of Gifts in the Body of Christ

For by the grace given to me I say to everyone who is among you not to think more highly of yourself than what one ought to think, but to think ⸤sensibly⸥\f + \fr 12:3 \ft Literally “so as to be sensible” \f*, as God has apportioned a measure of faith to each one.
For just as in one body we have many members, but all the members do not have the same function,
in the same way we who are many are one body in Christ, and ⸤individually⸥\f + \fr 12:5 \ft Literally “with respect to one” \f* members of one another,
but having different gifts according to the grace given to us: if \add it is\add* prophecy, according to the proportion of \add his\add* faith;
if \add it is\add* service, by service; if \add it is\add* one who teaches, by teaching;
if \add it is\add* one who exhorts, by exhortation; one who gives, with sincerity; one who leads, with diligence; one who shows mercy, with cheerfulness.
Living in Love
Love must be without hypocrisy. Abhor what \add is\add* evil; be attached to what \add is\add* good,
being devoted to one another in brotherly love, esteeming one another \add more highly\add* in honor,
not lagging in diligence, being enthusiastic in spirit, serving the Lord,
rejoicing in hope, enduring in affliction, being devoted to prayer,
contributing to the needs of the saints, pursuing hospitality.
Bless those who persecute,\f + \fr 12:14 \ft Some manuscripts have “who persecute you” \f* bless and do not curse \add them\add*.
Rejoice with those who rejoice; weep with those who weep.

Think the same \add thing\add* toward one another; ⸤do not think arrogantly⸥\f + \fr 12:16 \ft Literally “think not the arrogant” \f*, but associate with the lowly. Do not be wise ⸤in your own sight⸥\f + \fr 12:16 \ft Literally “in the sight of yourselves” \f*.
Pay back no one evil for evil. Take thought for \add what is\add* good in the sight of all people.
If \add it is\add* possible on your \add part\add*, be at peace with all people.

Do not take revenge yourselves, dear friends, but give place to \add God’s\add* wrath, for it is written, “Vengeance \add is\add* mine, I will repay,”\f + \fr 12:19 \ft A quotation from \xt Deut 32:35 \ft \f* says the Lord.

But “if your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him \add something\add* to drink; for \add by\add*\ef + \fr 12:20 \ft ﻿*Here “\add by\add*” is supplied as a component of the participle (“doing”) which is understood as means \ef* doing this, you will heap up coals of fire upon his head.”\f + \fr 12:20 \ft A quotation from \xt Prov 25:21–22 \ft \f*
Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
